page.title: 11VILLAGE SCHOOL HISTORY.
page.content: catering for 80 children.At first the new school consisted of only one classroom <now used for older Juniors> and is the classroom nearest the playground.A second classroom<now used for lower Juniors> was added in 1893. This classroom must have been badly needed at the time for a Log book entry in 1888 stated an average attendance of 119.9. No further extensions were made until 1976.Such extensions included an Infant classroom,School kitchen,Office and Staffroom.Alterations were made to the old kitchen <now the cloakroom> the former cloakroom becoming the Library.Atthe same time the ceilings of the two old classrooms were lowered. The village school remained an "all age" school until 1948 when Secondary children attended STOURPORT MODERN
